cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Key West, FL and 40 mi N of Varadero, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the Straits of Florida, expected to turn north-northwest and track up the west coast of the Florida peninsula toward the panhandle and southwestern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys (near Key West–Marathon corridor)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to Indian Pass; includes Port of Palm Beach District, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, and adjacent Atlantic/Gulf coasts
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with a 12% chance of 50-kt (58 mph) gusts; strongest winds Sunday morning through Sunday evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Palm Beach County coastline; higher values remain south of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of heavy rain with localized totals near 20 inches possible, bringing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and a low but non-zero tornado threat during rainbands
